meanings.definition: Conventionalities: the state or quality of being conventional
meanings.sent1: The strict adherence to conventionalities in their behavior was evident.
meanings.sent2: In this town, people follow the conventionalities of greeting each other with a handshake.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up at the party caused a hilarious breach of conventionalities.
meanings.sent4: She felt suffocated by the conventionalities that bound her like chains.
meanings.sent5: The artist's rebellious spirit rejected all conventionalities, creating bold and unique works.

meanings.definition: Conventionalities: established customs or practices in society
meanings.sent1: The traditional conventionalities of weddings include exchanging rings.
meanings.sent2: Learning the conventionalities of a new culture can be both challenging and exciting.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously exaggerated the conventionalities of a fancy dinner party.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, she broke all conventionalities and set new trends.
meanings.sent5: The book club discussed the conventionalities of book genres, sparking a lively debate.
